text: Aleksandr Fedotov Aleksandr Filippovich Fedotov (, 1841–1895) was a Russian actor, theater director, and playwright affiliated with the Maly Theater and one of the founders of Moscow's Society of Art and Literature in 1887.Leach, Robert (2004). Makers of Modern Theatre: An Introduction. London and New York: Routledge. p. 9. . He had a profound influence on the young Konstantin Stanislavski, who later wrote that He was the husband of actress Glikeriya Fedotova. ==References== Category:1841 births Category:1895 deaths Category:Russian male actors Category:Russian dramatists and playwrights Category:Russian male dramatists and playwrights Category:Russian theatre directors Category:19th-century Russian dramatists and playwrights Category:19th-century male actors Category:19th-century Russian male writers
title: Aleksandr Fedotov
